TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ChartGroup

Docs.summary: Represents one or more series plotted in a chart with the same format. The ChartGroup object is a member of the collection.

remarks.para: A chart contains one or more chart groups, each chart group contains one or more series, and each series contains one or more points. For example, a single chart might contain both a line chart group, containing all the series plotted with the line chart format, and a bar chart group, containing all the series plotted with the bar chart format.
Use ChartGroups(), where is the chart-group index number, to return a single ChartGroup object. If the chart has been activated, you can use the property.

Because the index number for a particular chart group can change if the chart format used for that group is changed, it may be easier to use one of the named chart group shortcut methods to return a particular chart group. The method returns the collection of pie chart groups in a chart, the method returns the collection of line chart groups, and so on. Each of these methods can be used with an index number to return a single ChartGroup object, or without an index number to return a ChartGroups collection. The following chart group methods are available:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the creator of the specified object (you can use this property with an OLE Automation object to return the application of that object).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlAxisGroup AxisGroup { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlAxisGroup get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlAxisGroup value); };

Docs.summary: Returns the group for the specified chart group or series.

remarks.para: For 3-D charts only xlPrimary is valid.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int BubbleScale { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the scale factor for bubbles in the specified chart group. Can be an integer value from 0 (zero) to 300, corresponding to a percentage of the default size. Applies only to bubble charts.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object CategoryCollection([in]object Index) runtime managed
Public Function CategoryCollection (Optional Index As Object) As Object

Docs.param: The name or number of the categories.
Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents a collection of all of the visible categories (a collection) in the chart group.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As XlCreator

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which this object was created. If the object was created in Microsoft Excel, this property returns the string XCEL, which is equivalent to the hexadecimal number 5843454C.

remarks.para: The Creator property is designed to be used in Microsoft Excel for the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Excel has the creator code XCEL.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int DoughnutHoleSize { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the size of the hole in a doughnut chart group. The hole size is expressed as a percentage of the chart size, between 10 and 90 percent.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DownBars As DownBars

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the down bars on a line chart. Applies only to line charts.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DropLines As DropLines

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the drop lines for a series on a line chart or area chart. Applies only to line charts or area charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int FirstSliceAngle { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the angle of the first pie-chart or doughnut-chart slice in degrees (clockwise from vertical). Applies only to pie, 3-D pie, and doughnut charts.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object FullCategoryCollection([in]object Index) runtime managed
Public Function FullCategoryCollection (Optional Index As Object) As Object

Docs.param: The name or number of the categories.
Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents a collection of all of the visible and filtered categories (a ) in the chart group.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int GapWidth { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Bar and Column charts: Returns or sets the space between bar or column clusters as a percentage of the bar or column width. Pie of Pie and Bar of Pie charts: Returns or sets the space between the primary and secondary sections of the chart.

remarks.para: The value of this property must be between 0 and 500.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Has3DShading { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the chart group has three-dimensional shading. This property only applies to surface charts and will return a run-time error if you try to set it to a non-surface chart.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool HasDropLines { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the line chart or area chart has drop lines. Applies only to line and area charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool HasHiLoLines { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the line chart has high-low lines. Applies only to line charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool HasRadarAxisLabels { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if a radar chart has axis labels. Applies only to radar charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool HasSeriesLines { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if a stacked column chart or bar chart has series lines or if a Pie of Pie chart or Bar of Pie chart has connector lines between the two sections. Applies only to stacked column charts, bar charts, Pie of Pie charts, or Bar of Pie charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool HasUpDownBars { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if a line chart has up and down bars. Applies only to line charts.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HiLoLines As HiLoLines

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the high-low lines for a series on a line chart. Applies only to line charts.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Index As Integer
public: property int Index { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the index number of the object within the collection of similar objects.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Overlap { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Specifies how bars and columns are positioned. Can be a value between –100 and 100. Applies only to 2-D bar and 2-D column charts.

remarks.para: If this property is set to –100, bars are positioned so that there's one bar width between them. If the overlap is 0 (zero), there's no space between bars (one bar starts immediately after the preceding bar). If the overlap is 100, bars are positioned on top of each other.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the parent object for the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RadarAxisLabels As TickLabels

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the radar axis labels for the specified chart group.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int SecondPlotSize { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the size of the secondary section of either a Pie of Pie chart or a Bar of Pie chart, as a percentage of the size of the primary pie. Can be a value from 5 to 200.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object SeriesCollection([in]object Index) runtime managed
Public Function SeriesCollection (Optional Index As Object) As Object

Docs.param: Optional Object. The name or number of the series.
Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents either a single series (a object) or a collection of all the series (a collection) in the chart or chart group.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SeriesLines As SeriesLines

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the series lines for a stacked bar chart or a stacked column chart. Applies only to stacked bar and stacked column charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ShowNegativeBubbles { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if negative bubbles are shown for the chart group. Valid only for bubble charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlSizeRepresents SizeRepresents { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlSizeRepresents get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlSizeRepresents value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets what the bubble size represents on a bubble chart. Can be either of the following XlSizeRepresents constants: xlSizeIsArea or xlSizeIsWidth.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlChartSplitType SplitType { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlChartSplitType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlChartSplitType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the way the two sections of either a Pie of Pie chart or a Bar of Pie chart are split.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ SplitValue { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the threshold value separating the two sections of either a Pie of Pie chart or a Bar of Pie chart.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int SubType { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Type { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property UpBars As UpBars
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::UpBars ^ UpBars { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::UpBars ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the up bars on a line chart. Applies only to line charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool VaryByCategories { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Excel assigns a different color or pattern to each data marker. The chart must contain only one series.
